CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 14 In particular , Guo et al. reported that OFETs based on a phthalimide - containing polythiophene exhibited hole mobilities of ∼ 0.2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 under ambient conditions without optimization. 14 Thiophene imide has simple , compact , symmetric , and planar structure. It could promote intrachain and interchain interactions along and between coplanar polymer chains. Zhang et al. pioneered to use thiophene imide as a building block in conjugated polymers. 15,16 Later , thiophene imide homopolymers were synthesized. 17-19 Recently , polymer solar cells based on blends of copolymers of thiophene imide and benzodithiophene 20-23 or cyclopentadithiophene 24 with soluble fullerene derivatives PC71BM or PC61BM exhibited PCEs of 3-6.8 % . Wudl et al. reported low - bandgap conjugated polymers based on thiophene - fused phthalimide , i.e. , isothianaphthene imides ( 5 , Figure 1 ). 25,26 2,2 0 -Bithiophene-3,3 0 -dicarboximide ( BTI , 6 , Figure 1 ) with π-core planarity , antiparallel BTI packing , a short cofacial π-π distance of 3.43 Å , and a favorable solubilizing group orientation is a promising building block in n - type polymers. 27 Facchetti et al. reported that n-channel OFET based on a bithiophene imide homopolymer exhibited a μ e of 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , I on / I off of 2 x 10^7 , and a high V th ( 75 V ) in vacuum after annealing process at 240 ° C. 27 The fused - ring system can maximize the π-orbital overlap by restricting intramolecular rotation in the oligomer and possibly to induce face - to - face π-stacking , facilitating charge transport through intermolecular hopping. On the other hand , the fused rings can make the polymer backbone more rigid and coplanar , therefore enhancing effective π-conjugation , lowering bandgap , and extending absorption. 28-31 Therefore , fused - ring building blocks are widely used in synthesis of conjugated polymers. 32-34 For example , the large planar benzodithiophene ( BDT ) unit has emerged as an attractive building block for conjugated polymers. 35 Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene ( 7 , Figure 2 ) with a curved structure prevents a fully conjugated pathway between substituents at the 2-and 6-positions. Hence , delocalization of the conjugated π-electron system along the copolymer backbone is disfavored by the incorporation of this unit. This increases the ionization potential of the polymer and is thus expected to improve air stability under operation. Additionally , compared to a single thiophene ring , it must be pointed out that due to the large resonance stabilization energy of BDT , the delocalization of electrons from the BDT unit into the backbone is less favorable than from the thiophene ring. As a result , a more stable copolymer with high performance can be obtained by using BDT as the core unit. OFETs based on a benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene copolymer manufactured on flexible substrate exhibited high hole mobility of 0.5 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 when the source-gate voltage is increased to 60 V.

Let's think step by step.

1. "Thiophene imide"
2. "Benzodithiophene"
3. "Cyclopentadithiophene"
4. "Isothianaphthene imides"
5. "Bithiophene-3,3'-dicarboximide" (BTI)
6. "Benzodithiophene" (BDT)

These are the "Material Name" entities in the given paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Material Name in the given paragraph:

1. Thiophene imide
2. Bithiophene-3,3'-dicarboximide (BTI)
3. Benzodithiophene (BDT)

I have removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to Material Name:

1. Phthalimide
2. Copolymers
3. Soluble fullerene derivatives (PC71BM or PC61BM)
4. Isothianaphthene imides
5. Cyclopentadithiophene

Please let me know if you have any further questions or if there's anything else I can help you with.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here are the valid entities in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Thiophene imide |
| Bithiophene-3,3'-dicarboximide (BTI) |
| Benzodithiophene (BDT) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

It could promote intrachain and interchain interactions along and between coplanar polymer chains. Zhang et al. pioneered to use thiophene imide as a building block in conjugated polymers. 15,16 Later , thiophene imide homopolymers were synthesized. 17-19 Recently , polymer solar cells based on blends of copolymers of thiophene imide and benzodithiophene 20-23 or cyclopentadithiophene 24 with soluble fullerene derivatives PC71BM or PC61BM exhibited PCEs of 3-6.8 % . On the other hand , the fused rings can make the polymer backbone more rigid and coplanar , therefore enhancing effective π-conjugation , lowering bandgap , and extending absorption. 28-31 Therefore , fused - ring building blocks are widely used in synthesis of conjugated polymers. 32-34 For example , the large planar benzodithiophene ( BDT ) unit has emerged as an attractive building block for conjugated polymers. 35 Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene ( 7 , Figure 2 ) with a curved structure prevents a fully conjugated pathway between substituents at the 2-and 6-positions. Hence , delocalization of the conjugated π-electron system along the copolymer backbone is disfavored by the incorporation of this unit. This increases the ionization potential of the polymer and is thus expected to improve air stability under operation. Additionally , compared to a single thiophene ring , it must be pointed out that due to the large resonance stabilization energy of BDT , the delocalization of electrons from the BDT unit into the backbone is less favorable than from the thiophene ring. As a result , a more stable copolymer with high performance can be obtained by using BDT as the core unit. Let's think step by step.

4. Cyclopentadithiophene
5. Isothianaphthene imides
6. 2,2'-Bithiophene-3,3'-dicarboximide (BTI)
7. Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene

These are the building blocks mentioned in the paragraph, which can be used to synthesize conjugated polymers.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material:

4. Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 14 In particular , Guo et al. reported that OFETs based on a phthalimide - containing polythiophene exhibited hole mobilities of ∼ 0.2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 under ambient conditions without optimization. 14 Thiophene imide has simple , compact , symmetric , and planar structure. It could promote intrachain and interchain interactions along and between coplanar polymer chains. Zhang et al. pioneered to use thiophene imide as a building block in conjugated polymers. 15,16 Later , thiophene imide homopolymers were synthesized. 17-19 Recently , polymer solar cells based on blends of copolymers of thiophene imide and benzodithiophene 20-23 or cyclopentadithiophene 24 with soluble fullerene derivatives PC71BM or PC61BM exhibited PCEs of 3-6.8 % . Wudl et al. reported low - bandgap conjugated polymers based on thiophene - fused phthalimide , i.e. , isothianaphthene imides ( 5 , Figure 1 ). 25,26 2,2 0 -Bithiophene-3,3 0 -dicarboximide ( BTI , 6 , Figure 1 ) with π-core planarity , antiparallel BTI packing , a short cofacial π-π distance of 3.43 Å , and a favorable solubilizing group orientation is a promising building block in n - type polymers. 27 Facchetti et al. reported that n-channel OFET based on a bithiophene imide homopolymer exhibited a μ e of 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , I on / I off of 2 x 10^7 , and a high V th ( 75 V ) in vacuum after annealing process at 240 ° C. 27 The fused - ring system can maximize the π-orbital overlap by restricting intramolecular rotation in the oligomer and possibly to induce face - to - face π-stacking , facilitating charge transport through intermolecular hopping. On the other hand , the fused rings can make the polymer backbone more rigid and coplanar , therefore enhancing effective π-conjugation , lowering bandgap , and extending absorption. 28-31 Therefore , fused - ring building blocks are widely used in synthesis of conjugated polymers. 32-34 For example , the large planar benzodithiophene ( BDT ) unit has emerged as an attractive building block for conjugated polymers. 35 Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene ( 7 , Figure 2 ) with a curved structure prevents a fully conjugated pathway between substituents at the 2-and 6-positions. Hence , delocalization of the conjugated π-electron system along the copolymer backbone is disfavored by the incorporation of this unit. This increases the ionization potential of the polymer and is thus expected to improve air stability under operation. Additionally , compared to a single thiophene ring , it must be pointed out that due to the large resonance stabilization energy of BDT , the delocalization of electrons from the BDT unit into the backbone is less favorable than from the thiophene ring. As a result , a more stable copolymer with high performance can be obtained by using BDT as the core unit. OFETs based on a benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene copolymer manufactured on flexible substrate exhibited high hole mobility of 0.5 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 when the source-gate voltage is increased to 60 V.

Let's think step by step.

1. First, let's identify the material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

* Hole mobility
* Ionization potential
* Bandgap
* Absorption
* Solubility
* Air stability
* Charge transport

2. Next, let's look for the values of these material properties in the paragraph:

* Hole mobility: 0.2 cm^2 V-1 s^-1 (under ambient conditions), 0.5 cm^2 V-1 s^-1 (with source-gate voltage of 60 V)
* Ionization potential: not explicitly mentioned, but it is mentioned that the incorporation of the benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene unit increases the ionization potential of the polymer.
* Bandgap: not explicitly mentioned, but it is mentioned that the fused-ring system can lower the bandgap and extend absorption.
* Absorption: not explicitly mentioned, but it is mentioned that the fused-ring system can extend absorption.
* Solubility: not explicitly mentioned, but it is mentioned that thiophene imide has a solubilizing group orientation that is favorable for solubility.
* Air stability: not explicitly mentioned, but it is mentioned that the incorporation of the benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene unit is expected to improve air stability under operation.
* Charge transport: not explicitly mentioned, but it is mentioned that the fused-ring system can facilitate charge transport through intermolecular hopping.

3. Finally, let's convert the values of the material properties to the appropriate units:

* Hole mobility: 0.2 cm^2 V-1 s^-1 (under ambient conditions), 0.5 cm^2 V-1 s^-1 (with source-gate voltage of 60 V)

The unit of hole mobility is cm^2 V-1 s^-1.

So, the values of the material properties mentioned in the paragraph are:

* Hole mobility: 0.2 cm^2 V-1 s^-1 (under ambient conditions), 0.5 cm^2 V-1 s^-1 (with source-gate voltage of 60 V)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
